messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['org.apache.commons.math.stat.FrequencyTest.testAddNonComparable()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
193 :     public void testAddNonComparable(){
194 :         try {
195 :             f.addValue(new Object()); // This was previously OK // error occurred here
196 :             fail("Expected IllegalArgumentException");
197 :         } catch (IllegalArgumentException expected) {
198 :         }
206 :     }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Object cannot be cast to java.lang.Comparable
	at org.apache.commons.math.stat.Frequency.addValue(Frequency.java:110)
	at org.apache.commons.math.stat.FrequencyTest.testAddNonComparable(FrequencyTest.java:195)
f = Value 	 Freq. 	 Pct. 	 Cum Pct. 
threeL = 3
twoL = 2
twoI = 2
threeI = 3
tolerance = 1.0E-14
oneL = 1
oneI = 1
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test `FrequencyTest.testAddNonComparable()` is in the `Frequency` class from the `org.apache.commons.math.stat` package. 

Next, I will retrieve the methods covered by failing tests for the `Frequency` class.

The failing test `FrequencyTest.testAddNonComparable()` is covering the `addValue(java.lang.Object)` method of the `Frequency` class in the Apache Commons Math library.

I will now retrieve the code snippet for the `addValue(java.lang.Object)` method to understand the cause of the failure.

messages.name: get_code_snippet
messages.content:
"108 :     @Deprecated
109 :     public void addValue(Object v) {
110 :             addValue((Comparable<?>) v);            
111 :     }"

The `addValue(Object v)` method in the `Frequency` class of Apache Commons Math library is deprecated and calls `addValue((Comparable<?>) v)`. This method expects the input to be `Comparable`, hence the `ClassCastException` when trying to add a non-`Comparable` object.

The bug is caused by calling the deprecated `addValue(Object v)` method with a non-`Comparable` object.

To fix the issue, the direct usage of `addValue(Object v)` with non-`Comparable` objects should be avoided, and the appropriate method should be used based on the type of the object being added.

The following methods need to be fixed:
```
org.apache.commons.math.stat.Frequency.addValue(java.lang.Object)
```

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).

m9.content:
The `addValue(Object v)` method in the `Frequency` class of Apache Commons Math library is deprecated and calls `addValue((Comparable<?>) v)`. This method expects the input to be `Comparable`, hence the `ClassCastException` when trying to add a non-`Comparable` object.

The bug is caused by calling the deprecated `addValue(Object v)` method with a non-`Comparable` object.

To fix the issue, the direct usage of `addValue(Object v)` with non-`Comparable` objects should be avoided, and the appropriate method should be used based on the type of the object being added.

The following methods need to be fixed:
```
org.apache.commons.math.stat.Frequency.addValue(java.lang.Object)
```
